1.text: My soul was weary in my life; I shall leave upon me my complaint; I shall speak in the bitterness of my soul.

2.text: Saying to God, Thou wilt not condemn me; make known to me for what thou wilt contend with me.

3.text: Is it good to thee that thou wilt oppress, that thou wilt despise the labor of thy hinds, and thou didst shine upon the counsels of the unjust?

4.text: Were eyes of flesh to thee? or wilt thou see as man saw?

5.text: Are thy days as manâ€™s days? or thy years as the days of man?

6.text: That thou wilt seek for mine iniquity, and wilt search out for my sins?

7.text: Upon thy knowledge that I will not do evil; and none delivering from thy hand.

8.text: Thy hands formed me, and they will work me together round about; and thou wilt swallow me down.

9.text: Remember now, thou didst make me as day; and thou wilt turn me back to dust.

10.text: Wilt thou not weigh me out as milk, and coagulate me as cheese?

11.text: Thou wilt clothe me with skin and flesh, and thou wilt hedge me with bones and sinews.

12.text: Thou didst with me life and mercy, and thy reviewing watched my spirit.

13.text: And these thou didst hide in thy heart: I knew that this is with thee.

14.text: If I sinned; and thou didst watch me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.

15.text: If I did evil, wo to me; and was I just, I shall not lift up my head, being filled with dishonor: and see thou mine affliction;

16.text: And shall it be lifted up? Thou wilt hunt me as the lion, and thou wilt turn back, thou wilt show thyself wonderful upon me.

17.text: Thou wilt renew thy testimonies before me, and thou wilt increase thy wrath upon me; changes and war with me.

18.text: And wherefore didst thou bring Me forth from the belly? I shall expire, and eye shall not see me.

19.text: I shall be as I was not; I shall be brought from the womb to the grave.

20.text: Is it not my days few? He will cease; he will turn from me, and I shall be cheerful a little,

21.text: Before I shall go and turn back to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;

22.text: A land of darkness, as thick darkness; of the shadow of death, and not orders, and the brightness, as thick darkness.
